info.description:
This document is written to support developers on integration of Non-SAP systems (also includes Cloud systems) with UIB .
This document provides the RESTFull APIs specification of Helper service . For Clouds system integrated with UIB, based on this, developers need to explain to the source systems the structure, parameters , sample values which UIB requires.
The authentication mechanism should be discussed as the earliest as possible. Depending on every each source system,  the authentication should be attached to all REST service requests.
The Helper service and ITSP ServiceNow are using techinical users , bTravel uses API key, and IPT with PriceFX is using JWT token for authentication.
fgfd
info.title: API structure for UIB to get data from Helper Service or NonSAP Cloud system

get.summary: Get count of the pending workitems for the current user, this number will be displayed in the UIB Tiles.
get.description: Retrieves the number of pending workitems for the current user. The Helper Service does not expose this API but it is recommended for Cloud systems to reduce the time for counting.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Unique user-name (Bosch's NTID) of the approver making a request.

parameters.name: X-API-Key
parameters.description: API key for Authentication.

200.description: Returns the count of pending workitems for the current user.

schema.description: The count of pending workitems for the current user.

400.description: The syntax of the sent request is invalid.

application/json.errorDescription: An error occured: 400 Bad Request

401.description: Unauthorized. You do not have provided valid authentication credentials to access the resource.

application/json.errorDescription: Full authentication is required to access this resource.

application/json.errorDescription: An error occured: 500 Internal Server Error

post.summary: Get pending workitems for the current user.As result, the data will be displayed in the Master list with corresponding selected filter criteria.
post.description:
When the user access UIB, UIB sends the following reuqest to Helper Service or Source system (for Cloud systems) to fetch data on connected source system for available pending work items based on logged-in user. This one return basic information related to all pending work items , such as title, creator/requestor, priority, and substitute. That data set display on the Master list.
In addition, criteria will send some filters to Source systems.As result, the data will be displayed in the Master list with corresponding selected filter criteria.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Provide a preferred language. If a translation is available, relevant texts are returned in this language.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Unique user-name of the approver making a request.

parameters.name: X-API-Key
parameters.description: API key for Authentication.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: Applicable for NonSAP system go through Helper Servive. Identifier agreed during integration for each system.

parameters.name: State
parameters.description: State of Work items. State `pending` means get all task definitions for pending work items (Inbox).State `processed` means get all task definitions for processed work items (Outbox)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Specify the filter and sort attributes for work items. Supports filter multiple values that are combined with ','. For example:
Status: `IN_PROGRESS,READY,RESERVED,COMPLETED,CANCELED`.
Priority: `MEDIUM,HIGH,LOW,VERY_HIGH`.
Operation:`eq, le, ge`.
SubstitutedUser: `null, T_UIB80001,T_UIB80002,T_UIB80003`.
State:`pending` or `processed`

200.description: Returns a list of work items for the current user.

results.TaskTitle: Enter accounting data 34566 (vendor: CALIBRATION LABORATORY CO,LTD.)

get.summary: The service fetch data for pending workflow types/workflow name/application name of source systems (for cloud) or of source system which is stored  in Elastic Search. As result, the data will be displayed at the popup Filter by Task Type
get.description:
UIB sends request to source system when a user clicks on the Filter button.The source system should return a list of process acccording to the pending work item available. 
For instance, Non-SAP systems has different forms, each form is a process (application). They are listed out eSignature, approval form, leave form, etc. If the pending work-items for a user contains eSignature, leave form, then the service return eSignature and Leave form.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Provide a preferred language. If a translation is available, relevant texts are returned in this language.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Unique user-name of the approver making a request.

parameters.name: X-API-Key
parameters.description: API key for Authentication.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: Required for NonSAP system go through Helper Servive. Identifier agreed during integration for each system.

parameters.name: State
parameters.description: State of Work items. State `pending` means get all task definitions for pending work items.State `processed` means get all task definitions for processed work items

200.description: Returns a list of task definitions for the current user.

400.description: The syntax of the sent request is invalid.

401.description: Unauthorized. You do not have provided valid authentication credentials to access the resource.

get.summary: The service fetch all the pending item of back-end system that is stored in Elastic Search. In addition, criteria will sent some filter to Helper Service for execution the query to Elastic Search. As result, the data will be displayed on Master list with corresponding selected filter criteria.
get.description:
1. Only NonSap systems which go through Helper Service use this endpoint for filtering because it will filter data already stored in Elastic search. Not recommend for Clould systems. Ex: ITSP ServiceNow will post the filter criteria when getting pendingWorkitems.
2.  User can filter tasks based on the main approver, allowing them to view tasks that require approval from specific individuals quickly
3.

get.description: UIB calls this API when a user clicks on one workitem in the pending workitem list (master list). The source system should return all necessary information in order for approver to make a decision, and all that information will be displayed in detail page .

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Provide a preferred language. If a translation is available, relevant texts are returned in this language.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Unique user-name of the approver making a request.

parameters.name: X-API-Key
parameters.description: API key for Authentication.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: Applicable for NonSAP system go through Helper Servive. Identifier agreed during integration for each system.

parameters.name: browserTimezone
parameters.description: Browser timezone for dynamic Grid table only.

parameters.name: InstanceID
parameters.description: The ID of the work item.

200.description:
Returns detail information of a work item.  In the response structure , in general : 

- WorkItemInfo > CustAttributes : all attributes declared in this section will be displayed in the "Information tab"
- DynamicGrids : in the "Information tab", if we want to display a table, all data of table like column headers, values... need to construct inside in this attribute
- TaskDefinitionID,TaskDefinitionName,CreatedByName,CreatedOn will be displayed in the Header section.
- The rest information is the general information of a workitem.

application/json.TaskTitle: Enter accounting data 34566 (vendor: CALIBRATION LABORATORY CO,LTD.)

HeaderMessage.MessageText: This work item cannot be proccessed in Unified Inbox as it requres additional actions in AP Moniter system. Hence, please use "Open Task" button in the buttom right conner to open this work item in AP Monito directly on yout desktop.

get.summary: Get Attachments of current work item
get.description:
UIB calls this endpoint when a user clicks on attachment tab and the workflow system should return a list of attachments of this workflow item.
UIB call this endpoint two times for getting information. 
- The first time: trigger when user click on the item on Master list in term of get the count of attachment 
- The second time: trigger when user click on the Attachment Tab Icon in Detail view, this request will fetch the actual items to show at attachment tab.

405.description: The action to be executed is not supported by the service.

error.errorDescription: An error occured: 405 Method Not Allowed

406.description: The requested object cannot be returned in the specified format according to the accept headers.

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request.

InstanceID.description: The ID of the work item.

TaskDefinitionID.description: The ID of the task definition this work item belongs to. The ID consists of the task definition name and the workflow definition ID  in lowercase using the following format: {task definition name}@{workflow definition ID}.

Status.description: The current status of the work item.

TaskTitle.description: The title of the work item as it appears in the inbox. Translation of this text is currently not supported.

CreatedOn.description: The time the work item was created.

CreatedBy.description: The user who created the work item. The user ID is at most 255 characters long.

CreatedByName.description: As of now, this returns the same value as the CreatedBy property. This is subject to change.

Processor.description: The user who works on the work item. The user ID is at most 255 characters long

CompletedOn.description: The time by which the work item must be completed.

SubstitutedUserName.description: The name of the Main user who is substituted. This is currently not implemented in SAP Workflow service and will always return null. This is subject to change.

Priority.description: The priority of the work item.

PriorityNumber.description: The numerical representation of the priority of the work item.

DynamicGrids.description: Dynamic Grids (table). If the attributes of dynamic Grids table contain datetime format. The value of these attributes need to be convert to `browserTimezone`

count.description: When '$inlinecount=allpages' is set as query parameter, count returns the number of results.

OrderBy.description: Sort maximum is 2 attributes. all cases of OrderBy: `Priority desc|CreatedOn desc` `Priority desc|CreatedOn desc` `Priority asc|CreatedOn desc` `TaskDefinitionID desc|CreatedOn desc` `TaskDefinitionID asc|CreatedOn desc` `Status desc|CreatedOn desc` `Status asc|CreatedOn desc` `Priority desc|CreatedByName asc` `Priority asc|CreatedByName asc` `TaskDefinitionID desc|CreatedByName asc` `TaskDefinitionID asc|CreatedByName asc` `Status desc|CreatedByName asc` `Status asc|CreatedByName asc` `Priority desc|TaskTitle asc` `Priority asc|TaskTitle asc` `TaskDefinitionID desc|TaskTitle asc` `TaskDefinitionID asc|TaskTitle asc` `Status desc|TaskTitle asc` `Status asc|TaskTitle asc` `Priority desc` `Priority asc` `CreatedOn desc` `CreatedByName asc` `TaskTitle asc` .(for example:`Priority desc|CreatedOn desc`)

InstanceID.description: The ID of the work item.

CreatedAt.description: The time the attachment was added.

CreatedBy.description: The attachment was added by whom (User ID)

CreatedByName.description: The attachment was added by whom (Fullname)

InstanceID.description: The ID of the work item.

ForwardToUserId.description: This attrubue for `Forward` or `Request Information` action

SubstitutionRuleID.description: The ID of the substitution rule.

User.description: The user who substitutes the current user.

BeginDate.description: The date on which the substitution begins (UTC time).

EndDate.description: The date on which the substitution ends (UTC time).

FullName.description: The user who substitutes the current user. The user name is identical with the value of the User field. The value of this field may change in future, so if you currently work with fullName you should consider to use the field "User" instead.

Mode.description: The mode of the substitution rule.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates whether the substitution rule is enabled.

SupportsDeleteSubstitutionRule.description: Indicates whether the substitution rule can be deleted.

SupportsEnableSubstitutionRule.description: Indicates whether the substitution rule can be enabled/disabled.

SubstitutionRuleID.description: The ID of the substitution rule.

User.description: The user who is substituted by the currently logged-in user.

BeginDate.description: The date on which the substitution begins (UTC time).

EndDate.description: The date on which the substitution ends (UTC time).

FullName.description: The user who substitutes the current user. The user name is identical with the value of the User field. The value of this field may change in future, so if you currently work with fullName you should consider to use the field "User" instead.

Mode.description: The mode of the substitution rule.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates whether the substitution rule is enabled.

SupportsDeleteSubstitutionRule.description: Indicates whether the substitution rule can be deleted.

SupportsEnableSubstitutionRule.description: Indicates whether the substitution rule can be enabled/disabled.

User.description: The user who should substitute the current user.

BeginDate.description:
The date on which the substitution should begin. It expects a UTC date. Please make sure to convert your timezone to UTC before sending a request. 

Additional requirements apply:
- It must be yesterday, today or in the future.

EndDate.description:
The date on which the substitution should end. It expects a UTC date.

Additional requirements apply:
- If the mode is 'PLANNED', it is required. Otherwise, it is ignored and set to null.          
- It must be equal to the begin date or be more recent. But it cannot be in the past.

Profile.description: Substitute profile ID. will discuss on All task group later

Mode.description:
The mode of the new substitution rule.

- PLANNED (planned substitution): The substitution rule is enabled immediately.
The substitute receives the tasks of the substituted user in the defined period.
- UN_PLANNED (unplanned substitution): The substitution rule is disabled by default and can be enabled by the substitute when needed 
(unplanned absence of substituted user). If enabled, the substitute receives the tasks of the substituted user starting on the defined begin date.

IsEnabled.description:
Indicates whether the new substitution rule should be enabled.

Additional requirements apply:
- If mode is 'PLANNED', it must be 'true'.
- If mode is 'UN_PLANNED', it must be 'false'.

MessageType.description: `E`: Error message. `W`: Warning message. `I`: Information message. `S`: Successful message

InstanceID.description: The ID of the work item.

TaskDefinitionID.description: The ID of the task definition this work item belongs to. The ID consists of the task definition name and the workflow definition ID  in lowercase using the following format: {task definition name}@{workflow definition ID}.

Status.description: The current status of the work item.

TaskTitle.description: The title of the work item as it appears in the inbox. Translation of this text is currently not supported.

CreatedOn.description: The time the work item was created.

CreatedByName.description: As of now, this returns the same value as the CreatedBy property. This is subject to change.

Processor.description: The user who works on the work item. The user ID is at most 255 characters long

CompletedOn.description: The time by which the work item must be completed.

SubstitutedUserName.description: The name of the Main user who is substituted by current user. If current user is main approver the value of this attribute will  return null.

Priority.description: The priority of the work item.

PriorityNumber.description: The numerical representation of the priority of the work item.

TaskDefinitionID.description: The ID of the task definition this work item belongs to. It consists of the task definition name and the workflow definition ID in the form {task definition name}@{workflow definition ID} in lowercase.

operator.description: Operator is `eq` means 'Equal'. Operator is `le` means 'Less Equal Than'. Operation is `ge` means 'Greater Equal Than'
Operator is `eq` means 'Equal'. Operator is `le` means 'Less Equal Than'. Operation is `ge` means 'Greater Equal Than'

TaskDefinitionID.description: supports filter multiple values that are combined with ',' (for example ':' `TASKID1,TASKID2,RBGA`).

Status.description: supports filter multiple values that are combined with ',' (for example: `IN_PROGRESS,READY,RESERVED,COMPLETED`).

Priority.description: supports filter multiple values that are combined with ',' (for example: `MEDIUM,HIGH,LOW,VERY_HIGH`).

State.description: pending : get pending work items (Inbox) proccessed : get proccessed work items (Outbox)

SubstitutedUser.description: supports filter multiple values that are combined with ',' (for example: `null, T_UIB80001,T_UIB80002,T_UIB80003`). if the attribute contains `null` means get workitems as main approver

InstanceID.description: The ID of the work item.

CreatedAt.description: The time the comment was created.

CreatedBy.description: the comment was written by whom (User ID)

CreatedByName.description: the comment was written by whom (Fullname)

Delete.description: Delete = true. File can be deleted by user

GroupName.description: If GroupName is not blank, attachements will group by GroupName.

InstanceID.description: The ID of the work item.

Label.description: the display Label of the object link

Nature.description: By default: - `POSITIVE` is `Approve`. - `NEGATIVE` is `Reject`. - `null` is others.
